study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of turmeric mouthwash and chlorhexidine gluconate mouthwash in preventing gingivitis and plaque formation.
results_summary: Chlorhexidine gluconate mouthwash showed a statistically significant reduction in plaque index compared to turmeric mouthwash, but no significant difference was observed in gingival index or total microbial count between the two. Both mouthwashes significantly reduced total microbial count.
population_specificity: 100 subjects aged 25-35 years with fair to poor gingival index scores and plaque index scores >1.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the antiplaque effects of an alcohol-free essential oil mouthwash versus an essential oil mouthwash containing alcohol using a 3-day plaque regrowth model.
results_summary: The study found that the essential oil mouthwash with alcohol had a significantly better inhibitory effect on plaque regrowth compared to the alcohol-free version, as evidenced by lower plaque indices across multiple mouth regions (p < 0.05). The alcohol-free mouthwash showed less effectiveness in inhibiting plaque buildup.
population_specificity: 30 volunteers in a double-masked, randomized, crossover clinical trial.
study_duration: 3 days per experimental period, with a 14-day washout between allocations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the adjunctive clinical effects of systemic ornidazole (ORN) combined with full-mouth scaling and root planing (SRP) compared to SRP alone in treating chronic periodontitis, including the role of 0.2% chlorhexidine mouthwash in pre-treatment oral hygiene.
results_summary: The test group (SRP + ORN) showed significantly greater reductions in probing depth (2.84 mm vs. 0.84 mm) and clinical attachment level (2.92 mm vs. 0.92 mm) compared to the control group (SRP + placebo) at 6 months. The study concluded that systemic ORN enhances periodontal treatment outcomes.
population_specificity: Adults with moderate-to-advanced chronic periodontitis (≥12 teeth with probing depth ≥4 mm).
effective_dosage: 0.2% chlorhexidine mouthwash (pre-treatment for 1 week); ORN dosage not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of Parodontax® mouthwash and toothpaste in reducing gingival inflammation and the enzymatic activity of aMMP-8 in gingival crevicular fluid.
results_summary: Parodontax® significantly reduced aMMP-8 levels in participants with moderate gingivitis, along with reductions in gingival inflammation and plaque accumulation. No significant changes were observed in the healthy control group.
population_specificity: 50 volunteers divided into two groups: 25 with moderate gingivitis (BOP +) and 25 with clinically healthy gingival conditions (BOP -).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of 0.12% chlorhexidine gluconate mouthwash in reducing bacterial contamination and endotoxin levels on metallic orthodontic brackets.
results_summary: The 0.12% chlorhexidine gluconate mouthwash significantly reduced levels of gram-negative periodontal pathogenic microorganisms compared to placebo, particularly in the orange complex, but increased bacterial endotoxin levels were detected.
population_specificity: 33 patients (ages 11-33 years) undergoing orthodontic treatment with fixed appliances.
effective_dosage: 0.12% chlorhexidine gluconate mouthwash used twice a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether mouthwash supplemented with a cranberry derivative could reduce cariogenic mutans streptococci.
results_summary: The study found that mouthwash with an isolated cranberry derivative significantly reduced cariogenic mutans streptococci. In vivo data partially supported the beneficial effects observed in vitro.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract does not detail human or animal subjects for mouthwash testing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of essential oil-formulated dentifrices on periodontal wound healing.
results_summary: Fourteen clinical studies showed reduced periodontal inflammation in the test group using EO dentifrices compared to placebo, and three studies demonstrated a reduction in periodontal pathogens. One study had inconclusive microbiological findings.
population_specificity: Individuals aged 18-70 years with periodontal conditions.
effective_dosage: Rinsing with EO-formulated dentifrices at least twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the antimicrobial activity of Iseganan HCl mouthwash versus placebo on the aerobic and facultatively anaerobic oral flora in myelosuppressed cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: Iseganan HCl mouthwash significantly reduced the total oral microbial load, particularly viridans streptococci, non-hemolytic streptococci, and yeasts, with a statistically significant difference compared to placebo. The effect was cumulative, showing greater reduction by the end of the treatment period.
population_specificity: Myelosuppressed cancer patients receiving chemotherapy (95% Iseganan group, 97% placebo group received myeloablative chemotherapy).
effective_dosage: 9 mg/3 ml, administered six times daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether using oral mouthwash (Listerine®) before lidocaine nasal spray application could improve pain and comfort outcomes during extended nasal endoscopic examinations.
results_summary: The study found that rinsing with oral mouthwash followed by lidocaine application significantly reduced discomfort during nasal examinations, though pain reduction did not reach statistical significance. Patients with nasal inflammatory conditions experienced greater pain relief.
population_specificity: 22 patients requiring extended bilateral flexible endoscopic nasal examinations at a tertiary care center.
effective_dosage: Not specified for mouthwash (only mentioned as a rinse).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and tolerability of DHEP mouthwash (Osmal®) with a commercially available diclofenac mouthwash for treating inflammatory conditions of the oral cavity.
results_summary: Both mouthwashes effectively reduced pain and inflammation, but DHEP mouthwash showed a significantly higher proportion of pain-free patients at day 3 (40% vs. 20%) and more marked reductions in pain scores. Both treatments were well tolerated with good compliance.
population_specificity: 80 patients with inflammatory conditions of the oral cavity, primarily gingivitis.
effective_dosage: 15 mL mouthwash (0.103% DHEP or 0.074% diclofenac), twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of a betaine-containing mouthwash, alone or combined with a night guard, in treating xerostomia.
results_summary: All three treatment groups (mouthwash, night guard, or both) showed symptom improvement in xerostomia, with better OHIP-14 scores and sialometry findings. No adverse effects were reported, and patient satisfaction was similar across groups.
population_specificity: 105 patients (8 men, 82 women) with dry mouth (xerostomia).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of chlorhexidine mouthwash in preventing or reducing oral mucositis in children undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: Four out of five studies showed a significant preventive effect of chlorhexidine mouthwash on the development or severity of oral mucositis, while one study found no benefit compared to placebo. The data suggest chlorhexidine may help reduce oral mucosal damage during chemotherapy, possibly by reducing oral microflora and plaque.
population_specificity: Children receiving chemotherapy for cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the safety and efficacy of phenylbutyrate 5% mouthwash in mitigating oral mucositis severity in head-and-neck cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy or chemoradiotherapy.
results_summary: Phenylbutyrate mouthwash significantly reduced mucositis severity compared to placebo, with no severe drug-related side effects reported. It also showed potential benefits in local control and overall survival rates.
population_specificity: Head-and-neck cancer patients receiving radiotherapy or chemoradiotherapy.
effective_dosage: 5 mL of phenylbutyrate 5% mouthwash, taken four times daily.
study_duration: Treatment began at mild mucositis onset and continued until 4 weeks after radiotherapy completion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate and compare the efficacy of different antiplaque mouthwashes in inhibiting plaque formation.
results_summary: Cetylpyridinium chloride combined with sodium fluoride showed the highest plaque inhibition, followed by chlorhexidine gluconate and sodium monofluorophosphate, while plaque levels increased in the control group. Only cetylpyridinium chloride with sodium fluoride and chlorhexidine gluconate demonstrated statistically significant antiplaque effects compared to the control.
population_specificity: Not specified beyond sample size (n = 6 per group).
effective_dosage: 5.0 mL mouthwash diluted with 10.0 mL water, rinsed for 30 seconds once daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of Listerine mouthwash on the retention of pink Locator attachments compared to other denture cleansing solutions.
results_summary: Listerine significantly increased the retention of Locator attachments (15.82 ± 4.7 N) compared to NaOCl (7.29 ± 1.0 N) and showed a lower percentage of retention loss (29 ± 9%) than water (53 ± 12%). However, the study did not recommend Listerine as a denture cleanser due to insufficient evidence.
population_specificity: Pink Locator attachments (denture-related components).
effective_dosage: Not specified (soaked for equivalent of 6 months of clinical use).
study_duration: Simulated 6 months of clinical use (548 pulls).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the response of patients with oral cGVHD to various doses of a new topical budesonide mouthwash and evaluate its efficacy and safety.
results_summary: Oral cGVHD improved in all patients, with a median reduction of 70%, and pain reduction was similar across all study arms. The safety profile was satisfactory, and the response was consistent regardless of dosing frequency or duration.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic graft-versus-host disease (cGVHD) involving oral tissues.
effective_dosage: 3 mg/10 mL applied 2 or 3 times daily for 5 or 10 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the therapeutic effects of aloe vera mouthwash with triamcinolone acetonide 0.1% in treating oral lichen planus.
results_summary: Both aloe vera mouthwash and triamcinolone acetonide significantly reduced pain, burning sensation, and lesion size, with comparable healing rates (74% vs. 78%). The effects persisted two months after treatment discontinuation.
population_specificity: 46 patients with oral lichen planus.
effective_dosage: Not specified (frequency implied as regular use over 4 weeks).
study_duration: 4 weeks of treatment, with follow-up at 2 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the clinical efficacy of Rosa damascena extract mouthwash in treating recurrent aphthous stomatitis compared to a placebo.
results_summary: The study found that the Rosa damascena mouthwash significantly reduced pain, ulcer size, and number of ulcers compared to the placebo on days 4 and 7, demonstrating its effectiveness in treating recurrent aphthous stomatitis.
population_specificity: 50 patients with recurrent aphthous stomatitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare fluoride release from Giomer and Compomer when exposed to different fluoride treatments, including fluoridated mouthwash.
results_summary: The study found that fluoride release was higher in Giomer than Compomer, with the highest release in the twice-daily fluoridated dentifrice group, followed by the once-daily dentifrice + mouthwash group. Fluoride release was greater in acidic demineralising solution than neutral remineralising solution.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study using specimens of Giomer and Compomer).
effective_dosage: Fluoridated mouthwash (225 ppm) used once daily in combination with fluoridated dentifrice (500 ppm).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of artificial saliva and citric acid mouthwash versus distilled water in relieving oral dryness and improving unstimulated salivary flow in patients with drug-induced xerostomia.
results_summary: Artificial saliva and citric acid provided immediate relief from oral dryness, with citric acid showing longer-lasting effects at 1 hour post-use. Neither treatment affected unstimulated saliva flow.
population_specificity: 54 patients reporting drug-induced xerostomia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy of chlorhexidine mouthwash disinfection on the stability of lactobacilli probiotic and its impact on salivary Streptococcus mutans counts.
results_summary: Chlorhexidine mouthwash significantly reduced Streptococcus mutans counts, which remained steady for 5 weeks. Combining chlorhexidine with probiotic yogurt (Lactobacillus rhamnosus GG) resulted in more stable colonization of LGG and sustained reduction in SM counts compared to probiotic alone.
population_specificity: 105 children divided into three groups.
effective_dosage: Chlorhexidine mouthwash for 2 weeks; probiotic yogurt (2 × 10^8 CFU/g of LGG) for 3 weeks.
study_duration: 2 weeks for chlorhexidine, 3 weeks for probiotic, with follow-up assessments up to 5 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of triclosan mouthwash in managing radiation-induced oral mucositis and compare it with conventional sodium bicarbonate mouth rinse.
results_summary: Triclosan mouthwash reduced the severity of mucositis, with only one patient in the study group progressing to grade 4 mucositis compared to 10 in the control group. The study group also experienced faster resolution of symptoms (less than 28 days vs. more than 45 days in the control group).
population_specificity: 24 patients who underwent radiation therapy for oral cancer and developed oral mucositis.
effective_dosage: Triclosan 0.03% W/V mouthwash for the study group; sodium bicarbonate 2 mg mouthwash for the control group.
study_duration: During and post-radiation treatment period (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review the effects of hydrogen peroxide mouthwashes on plaque accumulation and gingival inflammation, both as an adjunct to daily oral hygiene and as a mono-therapy.
results_summary: Hydrogen peroxide mouthwashes did not consistently prevent plaque accumulation as a short-term mono-therapy, but one long-term study showed they reduced gingival redness when used as an adjunct to daily oral hygiene.
population_specificity: Not specified (general population inferred from abstract).
study_duration: Up to 6 months (in the long-term study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of a 0.1% chlorhexidine mouthwash in treating chronic periodontitis and assess the impact of subgingival irrigation with the same product.
results_summary: The mouthwash slightly reduced gingival inflammation and significantly altered microbial composition, decreasing Gram-negative anaerobes and increasing Gram-positive cocci. No additional benefit was observed from pocket irrigation.
population_specificity: Sixty patients with chronic periodontitis.
effective_dosage: 0.1% chlorhexidine mouthwash, administered twice daily (frequency inferred from study design).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of a powered toothbrush combined with chlorhexidine mouthwash on dental plaque colonization by VAP-associated organisms and plaque removal in intubated patients.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in respiratory pathogen prevalence between groups but demonstrated a statistically significant greater reduction in dental plaque and lower bacterial counts with the powered toothbrush compared to the sponge toothette, both used with chlorhexidine mouthwash.
population_specificity: Intubated adults in a critical care unit within 48 hours of admission.
effective_dosage: 20 ml, 0.2% chlorhexidine mouthwash at each time point (four times per day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of an alcohol-free mouthwash containing 0.075% CPC and 0.05% NaF compared to a control mouthwash with only 0.05% NaF in reducing dental plaque and gingivitis over three and six months.
results_summary: The test mouthwash showed statistically significant reductions in gingival and plaque indices after three and six months compared to baseline and the control mouthwash, which either showed non-significant reductions or increases in these indices.
population_specificity: Adult male and female subjects from San Jose, Costa Rica, with baseline Gingival Index scores ≥1.0 and Plaque Index scores ≥1.5.
effective_dosage: Test group: 0.075% CPC + 0.05% NaF; Control group: 0.05% NaF (frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of two mouthwashes containing 0.075% CPC (one with 6% alcohol and one alcohol-free) in reducing dental plaque regrowth compared to a negative control mouthwash without CPC.
results_summary: Both CPC-containing mouthwashes significantly reduced plaque regrowth over 24 hours compared to the negative control, with no significant difference between the alcohol-containing and alcohol-free versions. The study concluded that both formulations were safe and effective for reducing plaque accumulation.
population_specificity: Subjects in a dental clinic setting (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).
effective_dosage: 0.075% CPC, used as a mouthwash (frequency: once 12 hours post-brushing).
study_duration: 24-hour periods per intervention, repeated in a crossover design.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the antimicrobial efficacy of two CPC-containing mouthwashes (one with alcohol and one alcohol-free) versus a control mouthwash in reducing supragingival plaque bacteria after single and 14-day use.
results_summary: Both CPC-containing mouthwashes significantly reduced anaerobic plaque bacteria compared to the control, with reductions of 34.5-35.3% after a single use and 70.9-73.8% after 14 days of use, showing no significant difference between alcohol and alcohol-free formulations.
population_specificity: 188 adults aged 23-69 (mean age 45.78).
effective_dosage: 20 mL rinsed for 30 seconds, twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antibacterial efficacy of three CPC-containing mouthwashes against common oral bacteria in a short-exposure in vitro assay.
results_summary: All three test mouthwashes achieved a statistically significant reduction of > 3 log CFUs (> 99.9% reduction) in viable bacteria of both Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans and Streptococcus mutans after 30 seconds of exposure.
population_specificity: In vitro study on two bacterial species (Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans and Streptococcus mutans).
effective_dosage: 0.075% CPC and 0.05% NaF (two alcohol-free, one with 6% alcohol).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antibacterial action of cetylpyridinium chloride (CPC) in mouthwash and its efficacy in plaque removal as an adjunct to mechanical tooth cleaning.
results_summary: The study found that mouthwash formulations containing CPC were effective against common oral bacteria and disrupted plaque biofilms. Clinical studies supported that daily use of 0.075% CPC mouthwash, with or without alcohol, complements mechanical plaque control.
population_specificity: Not specified (general oral bacteria and plaque biofilms were studied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of 0.2% chlorhexidine mouthwash (CHX-MW) against other treatments in inhibiting plaque accumulation during a 3-day non-brushing period.
results_summary: The study found that 0.2% CHX-MW was significantly more effective than the dentifrices (CHX-DFG and RDF) and comparably effective to 1% CHX-Gel in reducing plaque accumulation, with a mean plaque index of 0.79 after 3 days.
population_specificity: Subjects abstaining from oral hygiene for 3 days after professional prophylaxis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of a 0.025% hyaluronan-containing mouthwash compared to 0.2% chlorhexidine and a water-based mouthwash, and its antibacterial effects on periodontopathogens.
results_summary: The hyaluronan mouthwash was comparable to chlorhexidine in inhibiting plaque growth in vivo and significantly reduced the growth of Aa and Pi in vitro, though it had no effect on Pg. Both active mouthwashes showed significantly less plaque regrowth than the water-based control.
population_specificity: 45 volunteers in a hospital setting.
effective_dosage: 0.025% sodium hyaluronate, 0.2% chlorhexidine, and a water-based rinse (negative control).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of topical quercetin compared to benzydamine hydrochloride mouthwash in treating minor aphthous ulcers.
results_summary: Topical quercetin significantly reduced ulcer size and pain, with 100% healing within 7-10 days, outperforming the control group. Patients also reported high satisfaction with its ease of application, consistency, and taste.
population_specificity: 40 male patients with minor aphthous ulcers and no other oral mucosal pathology.
effective_dosage: Two to three dabs of quercetin applied topically three times daily.

study_goal: To determine the efficacy and acceptability of 0.074% diclofenac mouthwash in relieving pain and inflammation for post-periodontal surgery patients.
results_summary: Diclofenac mouthwash significantly reduced spontaneous pain but did not show significant reductions in gingival inflammation or swelling, though the test group had higher reductions. The mouthwash was deemed effective and tolerable for post-surgical symptomatic relief.
population_specificity: Twenty chronic periodontitis patients scheduled for full-mouth periodontal flap surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of triclosan-containing mouthrinse and dentifrice in reducing biofilm and gingivitis.
results_summary: The study found that the combination of triclosan mouthrinse and dentifrice significantly reduced Plaque Index compared to the control group, but no significant difference was observed in gingivitis reduction between groups. The association showed a faster reduction in bleeding levels.
population_specificity: Forty patients diagnosed with gingivitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of different interventions, including mouthwash, for maintaining and recovering soft tissue health around dental implants.
results_summary: The study found weak evidence that antibacterial mouthrinses (e.g., chlorhexidine and Listerine) are effective in reducing plaque and marginal bleeding around implants, but no statistically significant differences were found between different types of self-administered antimicrobials for maintaining or recovering soft tissue health.
population_specificity: Patients with dental implants, including those with peri-implant mucositis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare tooth staining and clinical efficacy between a chlorhexidine mouthwash with an antidiscoloration system (ADS) and a traditional 0.2% chlorhexidine mouthwash, while also assessing patient compliance and side effects.
results_summary: The test group (chlorhexidine with ADS) showed significantly less tooth staining than the control group, but both mouthwashes were equally effective as antiplaque and antigingivitis agents. Most patients followed the protocol, and only two reported a bad taste with both mouthwashes.
population_specificity: 15 non-smoking patients with chronic periodontitis at the Department of Periodontology, International University of Catalunya, Barcelona, Spain.
effective_dosage: 0.2% chlorhexidine mouthwash (control group) and chlorhexidine with ADS (test group), used for 15 days each.
study_duration: 15 days per mouthwash, with a 15-day washout period in between.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of Terminalia chebula aqueous extract rinse on salivary pH and Streptococcus mutans levels.
results_summary: The study found a significant reduction in S. mutans count at 5 and 60 minutes after rinsing with the extract, and salivary pH remained alkaline for 1 hour. The mouthrinse was acceptable to 80% of participants.
population_specificity: 30 subjects purposively selected and randomly divided into extract and control groups.
study_duration: Salivary samples were collected at 5 and 60 minutes post-rinsing.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of a mucoadhesive lipid-based tablet versus Biotène mouthwash in reducing symptoms of mouth dryness in xerostomic patients.
results_summary: The study found that the mucoadhesive tablet significantly reduced the sensation of mouth dryness compared to Biotène mouthwash and increased unstimulated saliva flow by 1.5-fold after 30 minutes. Biotène mouthwash was less effective in alleviating dryness symptoms.
population_specificity: Twenty xerostomic patients divided into two groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the antifungal activity of lawsone methyl ether mouthwash (LME) with chlorhexidine mouthwash (CHX) in vitro and in vivo.
results_summary: In vitro, 0.25% LME showed significantly greater antifungal activity than 0.12% CHX and was comparable to 0.2% CHX. In vivo, 0.025% LME demonstrated antifungal activity up to 2 hours, though lower than 0.12% CHX, with no allergic reactions reported and better taste/smell satisfaction compared to CHX.
population_specificity: HIV-infected subjects (n=22) and denture wearers (n=32).
effective_dosage: 0.25% LME (in vitro), 0.025% LME (in vivo), 0.12% and 0.2% CHX.
study_duration: Immediate effects measured up to 2 hours post-use.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the inhibitory effects of a chlorine dioxide (ClO2) mouthwash on morning oral malodor and salivary periodontal/malodorous bacteria over a 7-day period.
results_summary: The ClO2 mouthwash reduced morning bad breath (measured by organoleptic and gas chromatography methods) and decreased plaque, tongue coating accumulation, and counts of Fusobacterium nucleatum in saliva. No significant differences were found between groups at baseline.
population_specificity: 15 healthy male volunteers
effective_dosage: Twice per day (specific volume not stated)
study_duration: 7 days per treatment phase, with a one-week washout period

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if using a mint-flavored, alcohol-based mouthwash before applying oral lidocaine spray would improve the unpleasant taste of lidocaine.
results_summary: The study found that rinsing with the mouthwash significantly improved the perceived flavor of lidocaine, raising the taste rating from 20.77 mm to 50.2 mm on a VAS. There was a minimal, non-significant reduction in subjective analgesia after mouthwash use.
population_specificity: Fifteen able-bodied volunteers in a tertiary care hospital setting.
effective_dosage: 30-second rinse with mouthwash or placebo (plain water) before lidocaine administration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Cool Mint Listerine mouthwash on the retention and appearance of pink Locator attachments used in dentures.
results_summary: Cool Mint Listerine mouthwash increased the retentive values of the attachments compared to the control but caused blue discoloration. The study concluded that its effect on retention might be clinically unimportant, but it is not recommended due to color changes.
population_specificity: Pink Locator attachments (denture components)
effective_dosage: Equivalent of 6 months of clinical use (soaking duration)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a morphine-containing mouthwash could reduce oral pain in patients with radiotherapy- or chemotherapy-induced oral mucositis.
results_summary: The study found that pain alleviation was significantly influenced by the act of mouthwashing, with morphine showing a modest analgesic effect (p = 0.020). Pain relief duration was approximately 123.7 minutes for morphine, though most symptoms were likely related to the underlying disease rather than the mouthwash.
population_specificity: Patients with head and neck cancers suffering from radiotherapy- or chemotherapy-induced oral mucositis (mean age 55.1).
study_duration: 6 days (3 days per treatment arm in a crossover design).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether carbohydrate (CHO) mouth rinsing or ingestion improved cycling performance in a fasted and glycogen-reduced state.
results_summary: CHO mouth rinsing showed no ergogenic effects or changes in metabolic responses compared to placebo, while CHO ingestion improved performance and metabolic markers.
population_specificity: 9 moderately trained male cyclists
effective_dosage: 15% CHO mouth rinse (0.33 mL·kg(-1) body mass per dose), administered after every 12.5% of completed exercise
study_duration: Single 1-hour cycling time trial following overnight fast

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of allopurinol mouth rinse (1 mg/ml) in preventing fluorouracil-induced mucositis in patients undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that allopurinol mouth rinse was ineffective in preventing fluorouracil-induced mucositis. Higher education level and use of dentures were associated with reduced mucositis occurrence.
population_specificity: 33 patients with malignant disorders receiving 5-fluorouracil-containing chemotherapy.
effective_dosage: 1 mg/ml, administered 1, 2, and 3 hours after chemotherapy and three consecutive nights.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore determinants of doxyPEP awareness and uptake, and associations with HIV care outcomes, among U.S. MSM living with HIV.
results_summary: Among 827 participants, 13% were currently taking doxyPEP, 46% were aware of it but not prescribed it, and 41% had not heard of it. Neither awareness nor use of doxyPEP was associated with HIV care outcomes, but both were higher among participants with a recent bSTI and lower in certain U.S. regions.
population_specificity: Men who have sex with men (MSM) living with HIV in the U.S.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize non-epidemic Kaposi sarcoma (KS) in HIV-negative men who have sex with men (MSM) by identifying risk factors, presentation, treatment course, and prognosis.
results_summary: The study found that non-epidemic KS in HIV-negative MSM has a favorable prognosis, with 44% undergoing observation at diagnosis and 47% requiring recurrent treatment during follow-up. Only 2 of 7 deaths were attributed to KS, and 10% of patients developed a lymphoproliferative disorder.
population_specificity: HIV-negative men who have sex with men (MSM) with pathologically proven Kaposi sarcoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of health interventions (MIP) on mpox knowledge awareness among men who have sex with men (MSM).
results_summary: The MIP significantly improved mpox knowledge awareness, increasing total scores from 58.50 to 68.47 and the awareness rate from 48.66% to 64.60%. MSM preferred obtaining mpox information through new media and internet platforms, with no significant change in preferences post-intervention.
population_specificity: Men who have sex with men (MSM)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of HIV health education interventions for MSM by assessing changes in knowledge, attitudes, and behaviors across different cultures and regions.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in HIV knowledge, condom use over six months, and condom use in recent same-sex encounters post-intervention. Larger sample sizes (>500) or longer intervention durations (>1 year) enhanced the homogeneity of results.
population_specificity: Men who have sex with men (MSM) across different cultures and regions.
study_duration: Varied, with long-term interventions defined as >1 year

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a salutogenic strength-based intervention in enhancing sense of coherence and improving related health outcomes (stress, depression, ART adherence, CD4+ T cell count, viral load) among newly diagnosed HIV-positive MSM.
results_summary: The intervention significantly improved sense of coherence, reduced stress and depression, and maintained ART adherence in the intervention group, while the control group showed worsening outcomes in these areas. No significant differences were found in CD4+ T cell count or viral load between groups.
population_specificity: Newly diagnosed HIV-positive men who have sex with men (MSM).
effective_dosage: Not specified (8-week "Towards the Sun" program delivered via WeChat).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify barriers and facilitators of PrEP use among MSM living in rural areas of the United States.
results_summary: The study found that PrEP uptake in rural areas is hindered by limited awareness, geographic isolation, cost, and stigma, but nonmainstream information sources and interventions like telePrEP and financial assistance can enhance use.
population_specificity: Men who have sex with men (MSM) living in rural areas of the United States.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the prevalence of asymptomatic sexually transmitted infections (STIs) among men who have sex with men (MSM) living with HIV in Mexico City.
results_summary: The study found that 26.1% of participants tested positive for at least one STI via urethral PCR, with Ureaplasma urealyticum being the most prevalent (14.9%). Seroprevalence rates for syphilis, HBV, and HCV were 17.6%, 6.5%, and 3.1%, respectively, with current smoking and insertive anal sex as significant associated factors.
population_specificity: MSM living with HIV attending an HIV clinic in Mexico City.
study_duration: Cross-sectional study conducted from May 2022 to November 2023.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify qualities that would make a peer implementer credible for delivering HIV interventions to Latino men who have sex with men (LMSM).
results_summary: The study identified five key themes for peer credibility, including training in HIV prevention and care, verification and designation, accurate information dissemination, relatability and interpersonal skills, and engagement with the LGBTQ+ community.
population_specificity: Latino men who have sex with men (LMSM) and HIV service implementers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the characteristics, prevalence, and correlates of sexualized drug use (SDU) and chemsex among MSM, focusing on emotional vulnerability and STI risk.
results_summary: The study found that MSM engaging in SDU or chemsex were more likely to be in unstable relationships, engage in group sex, have multiple sexual partners, and exhibit symptoms of depression and anxiety. Chemsex participants also showed higher STI risk and inconsistent condom use compared to those only engaging in SDU.
population_specificity: Men who have sex with men (MSM) at high risk of STIs attending an STI/HIV unit in Rome, Italy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the coexistence and genotype distribution of HPV among MSM mpox patients in China.
results_summary: The study found high HPV positivity (80.4%) among MSM mpox patients, with multiple infections prevalent (56.9%), especially in HIV-positive individuals. HPV16 was the most common high-risk genotype, and HPV infection was significantly associated with HIV infection.
population_specificity: MSM (men who have sex with men) mpox patients in Shenzhen, China.
study_duration: Data collected from May to September 2023 (no intervention duration specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether seeking sexual partners in MSM venues remains a high-risk behavior for HIV and how venue-based interventions impacted HIV risk over time.
results_summary: The study found that MSM who sought partners in core venues had higher HIV risk, particularly from 2010-2014, but this risk decreased post-intervention to levels comparable to non-core venue seekers. HIV testing and service access remained higher among core venue seekers across all periods.
population_specificity: Men who have sex with men (MSM) in Shenzhen, China, surveyed between 2010-2022.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and acceptability of a sibling-based intervention (Entre Herman@s) to increase PrEP utilization among Latino men who have sex with men (LMSM).
results_summary: The pilot study demonstrated high feasibility, with 70% of enrolled LMSM commencing PrEP and 75% continuing at the 3-month follow-up. Participants who started PrEP reported significantly higher sibling closeness, and all affirmed their sibling influenced their decision.
population_specificity: Latino men who have sex with men (LMSM)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine earlier sexual debut as a risk factor for lifetime and recent substance use behaviors among MSM in Kazakhstan.
results_summary: The study found that MSM with earlier sexual debut (before 13 or between 13-15 years old) had significantly higher odds of lifetime binge drinking and illicit drug use, as well as recent binge drinking behavior. The majority of participants reported lifetime binge drinking (73%) and illicit drug use (65%).
population_specificity: Adult cisgender MSM in Kazakhstan (n=902).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the association between perceived HIV risk and PrEP adoption among Black MSM in Mississippi.
results_summary: The study found that higher perceived HIV risk was associated with lower odds of PrEP uptake among Black MSM, suggesting an inverse relationship influenced by social and structural factors. Despite high PrEP use (86.9%), those with high perceived risk were less likely to adopt it.
population_specificity: Black men who have sex with men (MSM) in a medium-sized city in Mississippi.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the determinants (barriers and facilitators) of PrEP implementation among Latino MSM and evaluate change methods to promote its adoption.
results_summary: The review found that most research focused on PrEP recipients' awareness and willingness, with limited studies on clinician and system-level factors. Few change methods were evaluated to enhance PrEP adoption and adherence.
population_specificity: Latino men who have sex with men (MSM)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore perceptions, knowledge, and access barriers related to PrEP use among MSM in Manaus, Brazil.
results_summary: The study identified negative perceptions about PrEP users, lack of information from health professionals, and social media's role in awareness. Barriers to access and adherence were highlighted, along with facilitators for PrEP use.
population_specificity: Mostly MSM in Manaus, Brazil, who had used PrEP at least once.
study_duration: Interviews conducted between April and July 2022 (study duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the accurate knowledge of U=U (undetectable equals untransmittable) among MSM in Chengdu, China, and explore associations between sexual risk behaviors, HIV testing, and socio-behavioral measures.
results_summary: Only 23.4% of MSM in the study had accurate knowledge of U=U. Factors associated with accurate knowledge included substance use during sex, recent HIV testing, HIV-related literacy, and perceived higher risk of HIV infection.
population_specificity: Men who have sex with men (MSM) in Chengdu, China.
study_duration: Cross-sectional survey conducted from March to May 2022.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of internet platforms for distributing HIV self-tests (HIVSTs) to Black and Hispanic MSM and transgender women (TGW).
results_summary: The study found that internet platforms effectively recruited MSM and TGW, with 9.1% of MSM and 7% of TGW reporting positive HIVST results. Dating platforms recruited higher percentages of MSM with positive results compared to general interest platforms, and MSM who had never tested before reported higher positivity rates.
population_specificity: Black or African American and Hispanic or Latino men who have sex with men (MSM) and transgender women (TGW).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study involved HIV self-test distribution, not MSM supplementation).
study_duration: 4 months (with follow-up surveys and additional HIVST mailing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether sexual alcohol expectancies (SAEs) moderate the relationship between daily alcohol intoxication and sexual behavior, particularly condom use, in MSM.
results_summary: The study found that SAEs moderated a curvilinear association between intoxication and anal intercourse with a condom, showing a more pronounced inverted U-shape in individuals with strong SAEs, but no moderation effect was observed for condomless anal intercourse (CAI).
population_specificity: 248 moderate- to heavy-drinking men who have sex with men (MSM)
study_duration: Two 23-day bursts of ecological momentary assessment

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine changes in HIV testing and medical care among men who have sex with men (MSM) in Russia between 2010 and 2017.
results_summary: The study found increases in HIV testing, antiretroviral therapy (ART) usage, and undetectable viral load rates among MSM in Russia from 2010 to 2017, though unmet prevention and treatment needs remain substantial.
population_specificity: Men who have sex with men (MSM) in Russia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the prevalence of HTLV-1 and HBsAg positivity among MSM attending an HIV clinic in Trinidad compared to heterosexual males.
results_summary: The study found that 1.67% of MSM were HIV-1/HTLV-1-coinfected, 5.10% were HIV-1/HBsAg-coinfected, and 0.16% had all three viruses, with no significant differences compared to heterosexual males. No HTLV-1-related diseases or deaths from chronic liver disease were reported among coinfected patients.
population_specificity: Self-identified MSM (n=1255) and heterosexual males (n=1822) attending an HIV clinic in Trinidad.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the potential effects of HIV on an mpox outbreak in the MSM population and the effectiveness of combined interventions (ART, condom use, and reduced sexual contact) in controlling mpox transmission.
results_summary: The study found that HIV can facilitate the spread of mpox in an MSM population, and HIV treatment with ART alone may not be sufficient to control mpox. However, combining ART with moderate condom use or reduced sexual contact was beneficial in controlling mpox transmission.
population_specificity: Men who have sex with men (MSM)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify factors associated with willingness to use daily oral and long-acting injectable PrEP among substance-using men who have sex with men (SU-MSM) in Southern U.S. states.
results_summary: The study found high willingness for both daily oral PrEP (78%) and LAI PrEP (66%), with distinct sociodemographic and behavioral factors influencing willingness for each. Black SU-MSM showed greater willingness for LAI PrEP, while lower willingness was associated with higher non-injection opioid use.
population_specificity: Substance-using men who have sex with men (SU-MSM) recruited from STI clinics, syringe services programs, and substance use treatment programs in eight Southern U.S. cities.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the cost-effectiveness and epidemiological impact of six implementation interventions designed to improve HIV testing and PrEP uptake in three US metropolitan areas.
results_summary: The study found that interventions to improve HIV testing were most cost-effective in Atlanta and Los Angeles, while PrEP-related interventions were most cost-effective in Miami. The most impactful interventions, CyBER/testing and PrEPmate, significantly reduced HIV acquisitions over 20 years.
population_specificity: Three US metropolitan areas (Atlanta, Los Angeles, Miami) with a focus on HIV prevention and diagnosis.
study_duration: 10 years of sustained intervention, evaluated over a 20-year horizon.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the molecular transmission patterns of HIV-1 genotypes among men who have sex with men (MSM) in Chongqing.
results_summary: The study found that CRF07_BC and CRF01_AE were the predominant HIV-1 subtypes among MSM in Chongqing, with a 61.4% entry rate into the molecular network. Transmitted drug-resistance mutations were present in 4.34% of cases, primarily affecting NNRTIs.
population_specificity: Men who have sex with men (MSM) in Chongqing, China.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the evolution of HIV incidence in MSM in Cyprus until 2030 and evaluate the impact of different intervention scenarios, including PrEP and behavioral changes, on reducing HIV incidence.
results_summary: The study found that reaching the 95-95-95 HIV cascade of care targets would reduce HIV incidence by 48.6% by 2030, while expanding PrEP to high and medium-risk MSM and implementing behavioral interventions could achieve a 90% reduction target. Without these measures, Cyprus will not meet its HIV incidence reduction goal by 2030.
population_specificity: Men who have Sex with Men (MSM) in the Republic of Cyprus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to clarify differences in intestinal microbiota composition among uninfected MSM and non-MSM healthy controls, investigate early-stage microbial changes after HIV infection, and assess ART's impact on gut microbiota.
results_summary: Uninfected MSM showed distinct microbiota compositions compared to non-MSM controls, with altered abundances of specific bacterial taxa. MSM on ART had reduced microbiota diversity and worsened dysbiosis, with NNRTI-based treatment causing notable changes.
population_specificity: Men who have sex with men (MSM), including uninfected MSM, recently HIV-infected MSM, MSM on ART, and non-MSM healthy controls (30 individuals per group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review risk factors, transmission patterns, pathogenesis, vaccine, and treatment options for mpox among MSM and people living with HIV (PLWH).
results_summary: The study highlighted atypical presentations of mpox during the 2022 outbreak, including genital lesions and sexual transmission among MSM, and discussed the disproportionate risk for HIV transmission in this population. It also provided global case and death statistics, emphasizing the impact on MSM and PLWH.
population_specificity: MSM (men who have sex with men) and people living with HIV (PLWH).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze awareness of Mpox among MSM visiting VCT clinics in Shenzhen and identify factors influencing this awareness.
results_summary: Awareness rates for primary Mpox indicators ranged from 52.5% to 87.8%, while secondary indicators were below 60%. Higher education and concern about Mpox's impact on work/learning promoted awareness, while fear of mortality hindered it.
population_specificity: 262 MSM (mostly unmarried, 79.0% HIV-positive) visiting VCT clinics in Shenzhen.
study_duration: Data collected from June 16 to 30, 2023 (cross-sectional study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the prevalence of tuberculosis symptoms among HIV-positive MSM in Zimbabwe using a WHO TB screening algorithm.
results_summary: All participants reported at least one TB symptom, with 40% of HIV-positive MSM experiencing a recent cough and 13% reporting unexpected weight loss. The overall prevalence of TB symptoms among HIV-positive MSM was 23%.
population_specificity: 1538 MSM in Zimbabwe, including HIV-positive individuals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore barriers and facilitators of PrEP initiation and adherence among young MSM (YMSM) in Thailand to inform intervention programs.
results_summary: The study identified barriers to PrEP initiation (e.g., limited accessibility, efficacy concerns) and adherence (e.g., forgetfulness, low risk awareness), as well as facilitators (e.g., PrEP information, reminders, counseling). Healthcare providers also highlighted additional barriers like low self-perception of HIV risk and fears of side effects.
population_specificity: Young MSM (YMSM) aged 15-24 in Thailand, along with healthcare providers from three clinics in Bangkok.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate perceptions of a community-informed, status-neutral HIV/STI testing intervention (SS4SH) compared to clinic-based testing among Black gay, bisexual, and other men who have sex with men (GBM).
results_summary: Participants preferred SS4SH for its comfort, privacy, accessibility, and efficiency, and desired more diverse representation in outreach materials. The intervention demonstrated potential to reduce barriers and stigma in accessing HIV services.
population_specificity: Black gay, bisexual, and other men who have sex with men (GBM), aged 21-65, with 40% living with HIV.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to estimate the prevalence and coinfection rates of bacterial STIs among sexually active, HIV-positive MSM and assess the potential benefits of different combination treatment regimens for managing concurrent bacterial STIs.
results_summary: The study found that bacterial STIs were prevalent (57.9% had at least one pathogen, 32.9% had coinfections), with U. urealyticum being the most common. Combination therapies (e.g., benzathine penicillin G with doxycycline or ceftriaxone with doxycycline) showed potential for treating concurrent infections.
population_specificity: HIV-positive men who have sex with men (MSM) with symptoms suggestive of STIs or recent HCV/syphilis infection.
effective_dosage: Not specified (combination therapies mentioned but dosages not detailed).
study_duration: Study period was from September 2021 to September 2023 (intervention duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the diagnostic value of the TP rapid syphilis test compared to a diagnostic algorithm (RPR-TPHA) among MSM.
results_summary: The TP rapid test demonstrated high sensitivity (95.8%) and specificity (96.6%) compared to the diagnostic algorithm, with strong predictive values (PPV 92%, NPV 98%) and accuracy (96%). The AUC of 0.962 further supports its diagnostic reliability.
population_specificity: Men who have sex with men (MSM) at Dr Mohammad Hoesin Palembang General Hospital.
study_duration: Study conducted from November 2022 to January 2023 (cross-sectional design).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to update trends of HIV-1 prevalence and incidence and identify hot-spots of ongoing transmission among MSM in Sichuan province between 2018 and 2022.
results_summary: The study found declining trends in HIV-1 prevalence (2.74%) and incidence (3.69%) among MSM, with Luzhou city identified as a high-incidence hot-spot (10.74%). The findings suggest a need for targeted interventions in high-risk areas.
population_specificity: Men who have sex with men (MSM) in Sichuan province, China.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to study changes in sexual behavior among MSM with HIV before and after diagnosis, focusing on factors like inconsistent condom use, PrEP use by partners, and STI incidence.
results_summary: The study found that inconsistent condom use increased significantly after HIV diagnosis, with PrEP use by partners becoming a common reason. STI incidence remained high, associated with factors like younger age, higher partner numbers, and lack of stable relationships.
population_specificity: Newly diagnosed men who have sex with men (MSM) with HIV, enrolled in the ANRS PRIMO Cohort.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess fertility attitudes, associated factors, and reproductive knowledge among HIV-positive men who have sex with men (MSM).
results_summary: About 35.6% of HIV-positive MSM expressed fertility desire, with those without siblings more likely to have this desire. Surrogacy was the most desired reproductive method, and reproductive knowledge accuracy was only 69.6%.
population_specificity: HIV-positive men who have sex with men (MSM), predominantly aged 18-30 and mostly single.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the experiences of GBMSM in Russia with Chemsex and their challenges in accessing medical care.
results_summary: GBMSM engaged in Chemsex primarily for pleasure but reported addiction and perceived dangers during group sessions. They faced stigmatization from both the GBMSM community and medical professionals, with legal barriers further limiting access to care.
population_specificity: Gay, bisexual, and men who have sex with men (GBMSM) in Moscow and Yekaterinburg, Russia (n=19).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the engagement of HIV-negative men who have sex with men (MSM) and partners of people with HIV (PHIV) in the Netherlands regarding the importance and relevance of an HIV cure.
results_summary: Most participants believed an HIV cure could reduce HIV burden, viewing both eradication and suppression as acceptable outcomes. Engagement was often passive due to low perceived susceptibility despite high perceived severity of HIV.
population_specificity: HIV-negative MSM not in relationships with a partner with HIV (n=19) and partners of PHIV (n=16) in the Netherlands.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate sociodemographic factors associated with late HIV diagnosis among Ghanaian men who have sex with men (MSM).
results_summary: The study found that older age groups were at higher risk of late HIV diagnosis compared to the 18-24 age group, with age being the only consistent demographic factor associated with late diagnosis. The findings highlight the need for targeted interventions to address age-related disparities in timely HIV diagnosis among MSM in Ghana.
population_specificity: Ghanaian men who have sex with men (MSM) exposed to HIV through same-gender sexual contact.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the influence of NAD+ supplementation on adverse cardiac remodeling and aging.
results_summary: NAD+ precursors, such as nicotinamide riboside, showed potential protective effects on the heart, alleviating chronic heart failure via mitochondrial redox mechanisms and improving lifespan in mice.
population_specificity: Mice (animal study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the contribution of TLR2, TLR6, and NOX2 to TMAO-induced inflammatory reactions in macrophages, potentially clarifying TMAO's proatherogenic role.
results_summary: TMAO at 300 μM significantly increased TLR2 and NOX2 expression in macrophages, suggesting their involvement in TMAO-induced inflammation, while TLR6 expression remained unaffected.
population_specificity: U937-derived macrophages

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of shikonin in modulating the NOX4/PTEN/AKT pathway to improve sepsis-induced acute kidney injury (AKI) in rats and human HK-2 cells.
results_summary: Shikonin significantly reduced kidney injury, oxidative stress, and inflammation by inhibiting NOX4, PTEN, and p-p65 while increasing p-AKT and Bcl-2 expression, demonstrating protective effects in sepsis-induced AKI.
population_specificity: Rats with sepsis-induced AKI and human HK-2 cells (kidney tubular epithelial cells).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of liraglutide on NAFLD and its mechanism involving RAGE/NADPH, including oxidative stress and liver cell apoptosis.
results_summary: Liraglutide improved liver fibrosis, reduced ROS levels, and decreased inflammatory factors in HFD-fed mice and cultured cells. Its protective effects were linked to reduced oxidative stress and hepatic stellate cell activation via RAGE/NOX2.
population_specificity: High-fat diet-fed mice and cultured mouse liver stellate (JS-1) and AML12 cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential role of NAD+ metabolome disruption in PACS pathogenesis and evaluate intravenous NAD+ as a therapeutic intervention for symptom management.
results_summary: The study suggests that SARS-CoV-2-induced NAD+ depletion may contribute to mitochondrial dysfunction, oxidative stress, and inflammation in PACS, proposing intravenous NAD+ administration as a potential treatment. However, specific clinical outcomes or efficacy data are not detailed.
population_specificity: Acute COVID-19 convalescents experiencing post-acute COVID-19 syndrome (PACS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the role of the Nampt/NAD+/SIRT1 pathway in intervertebral disc degeneration (IVDD) and its regulation of autophagy in nucleus pulposus cells.
results_summary: The study found that SIRT1 expression was reduced in degenerative nucleus pulposus tissues and correlated with disease severity. The Nampt/NAD+/SIRT1 pathway was shown to regulate autophagy in nucleus pulposus cells, suggesting a potential therapeutic target for IVDD.
population_specificity: 26 patients with lumbar disc herniation (experimental group) and 20 patients with burst fracture of the lumbar spine (control group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate NOX2 expression and functional recovery following facial nerve injury and assess the effects of antioxidant intervention (alpha lipoic acid) on nerve regeneration.
results_summary: The study found higher NOX2 expression in axotomy-type injuries compared to crushing injuries, with alpha lipoic acid (ALA) further increasing NOX2 expression, particularly in axotomy cases. Behavioral recovery was better in crushing injuries, and ALA improved recovery outcomes in this group.
population_specificity: 6-week-old male Sprague-Dawley rats with induced facial nerve injuries (compression or cutting).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide (NAD+) to reduce halo blight disease severity on snap bean caused by Pseudomonas syringae pv. phaseolicola.
results_summary: NAD+ significantly reduced disease severity when applied via soil drench, foliar spray, or leaf infiltration, with 0.5 to 1.0 mM being most effective. It also enhanced disease suppression when combined with copper hydroxide. NAD+ upregulated defense-related genes but showed no direct inhibitory effects on the pathogen.
population_specificity: Snap bean plants infected with Pseudomonas syringae pv. phaseolicola.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how high concentrations of β-hydroxybutyrate (BHB) impair neutrophil extracellular traps (NET) release via PI3K-mediated NADPH oxidase ROS production, partly explaining immune dysfunction in ketotic cows.
results_summary: BHB inhibited NET release by reducing ROS production via the PI3K pathway, confirmed by the reversal of BHB's effects using a PI3K activator (740Y-P). These findings suggest BHB-induced immune dysfunction involves NADPH oxidase-derived ROS suppression.
population_specificity: Peripartal dairy cows (within 3 weeks postpartum).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the inhibitory effect of NADH on purified ACE activity and its potential role in preventing hypertension.
results_summary: NADH exhibited a non-competitive inhibitory effect on ACE activity, with IC50 and Ki values of 244.33 µM and 175.08 µM, respectively, suggesting antioxidant substances like NADH might help prevent hypertension.
population_specificity: Purified ACE from sheep kidneys (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Not specified (in vitro concentrations used: IC50 = 244.33 µM, Ki = 175.08 µM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how NAD+ metabolism influences immune response and inflammatory conditions, with a focus on multiple sclerosis, inflammatory bowel diseases, and inflammageing.
results_summary: The study highlights NAD+'s role in regulating cellular functions like energy metabolism, DNA repair, and inflammation, suggesting that pharmacological manipulation of NAD+ availability may have immune-modulatory properties in inflammatory disorders.
population_specificity: Not specified (broad focus on inflammatory conditions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the roles of NAD(H) and NADP(H) in cellular redox balance, metabolic homeostasis, and their implications in various diseases.
results_summary: The study highlights the critical role of NADPH in maintaining cellular redox balance and energy metabolism, but its effects are context-dependent—both deficiency and excess can disrupt homeostasis and contribute to disease states. Further research is needed to clarify NADPH's role in disease mechanisms and potential therapeutic applications.
population_specificity: Not specified (cellular and metabolic focus)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of NADPH oxidase (NOX2 and NOX4) in Alzheimer's disease (AD) and explore the potential of NADPH oxidase inhibitors as a therapeutic target.
results_summary: The study highlights that NADPH oxidase is overexpressed in AD, contributing to oxidative stress and neuronal damage, and proposes it as a therapeutic target, though no specific NADPH oxidase inhibitors for AD treatment currently exist.
population_specificity: Focused on Alzheimer's disease models and brain cells (neurons, astrocytes, microglia).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the therapeutic potential and mechanisms of exogenous nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide+ (NAD+) in improving post-resuscitation myocardial and neurologic dysfunction in a rat model of cardiac arrest.
results_summary: NAD+ treatment improved mean arterial pressure, ejection fraction, Neurologic Deficit Score, and survival rate compared to the control group. It also restored adenosine triphosphate levels and mitochondrial complex I respiratory function, likely via activation of the Sirtuin3-NDUFA9 deacetylation pathway.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley rats subjected to cardiac arrest and resuscitation.
effective_dosage: 20 mg/kg, administered intravenously at the onset of return of spontaneous circulation.
study_duration: Effects were measured up to 72 hours post-resuscitation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of natural compounds, including Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide (NAD)-related mechanisms, in mitigating doxorubicin-induced cardiotoxicity.
results_summary: The study found that oxidative stress and p53 activation play key roles in doxorubicin-associated cardiotoxicity, with NADPH oxidase (NOX) activation leading to excessive reactive oxygen species. Natural compounds, particularly flavonols, flavonoids, and proanthocyanidins, showed protective effects against cardiotoxicity by stabilizing radicals and inhibiting NOX assembly.
population_specificity: Preclinical and pharmaceutical studies (not specified if human or animal models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether NAD+ could prevent and treat multiple sclerosis-triggered optic neuritis by examining its effects on inflammation, demyelination, and retinal ganglion cell apoptosis in a mouse model.
results_summary: NAD+ intervention reduced EAE severity, inflammatory infiltration, demyelination, and RGC apoptosis while enhancing anti-inflammatory cytokine expression and SIRT1 signaling. The therapeutic effect of NAD+ was reversed by SIRT1 inhibition, suggesting its mechanism involves SIRT1 activation.
population_specificity: Female C57BL/6 mice with experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis (EAE) as a model for multiple sclerosis-triggered optic neuritis.
effective_dosage: 250 mg/kg NAD+ daily via intraperitoneal injection.
study_duration: Administered after immunization and EAE onset (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an artificial enzyme combination for continuous NAD+ regeneration without expensive reagents or byproducts, and to test its applications in glucose sensing and methemoglobin reduction.
results_summary: The study successfully created a silica nanoreactor with three enzymes (LDH, LOX, CAT) that continuously produced NAD+ from oxygen and water, demonstrating its utility in glucose metabolism and converting methemoglobin to hemoglobin.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro/enzymatic study)
effective_dosage: Minimal amount of pyruvate (exact dosage not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a label-free, sensitive method for detecting NAD+ using a trifunctional split dumbbell probe and ligation-triggered isothermal rolling circle amplification (RCA).
results_summary: The study successfully developed a highly sensitive and selective method for NAD+ detection, achieving a detection limit of 85.6 fM and demonstrating applicability in complex biological samples and cancer cells. The method leverages NAD+-dependent ligation and RCA amplification for accurate monitoring.
population_specificity: Complex biological samples and cancer cells (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore whether increased NAD+ levels and altered NAD+/NADH ratios during ketogenic diet therapy could serve as a unifying mechanism for its beneficial effects on seizures and metabolic health.
results_summary: The study suggests that increased NAD+ levels during ketogenic diet therapy may contribute to reduced seizures and broader metabolic, immunological, and neurological benefits, proposing it as a potential common mechanism for these effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on metabolic and neurological conditions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether hypoxia-responsive polymer micelles could enhance ferroptotic antitumor efficacy by depleting NADPH, glutathione, and thioredoxin in solid tumors.
results_summary: The study found that hypoxia-responsive micelles selectively depleted NADPH, glutathione, and thioredoxin in 4T1 tumor cells, enhancing ferroptotic cell death without harming healthy organs. The approach was validated in vivo using a 4T1 tumor xenograft mice model.
population_specificity: 4T1 tumor xenograft mice model (murine breast cancer cells).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the therapeutic potential of NAD+ in alleviating symptoms of experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis (EAE), a mouse model of multiple sclerosis, focusing on autophagy regulation and NLRP3 inflammasome activity.
results_summary: NAD+ treatment reduced demyelination, nerve injury, and microglial activation, improved motor function, enhanced autophagy-related proteins (LC3-II/I, Beclin 1), suppressed NLRP3 inflammasome activity, and modulated inflammatory cytokine profiles. The benefits were reversed by the autophagy inhibitor 3-MA.
population_specificity: Female C57BL/6 mice with induced EAE.
study_duration: Duration not explicitly stated (daily injections post-immunization until analysis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether extracellular secretions of Pyo and NADH could enhance the degradation of phenanthrene in wastewater and improve its bioavailability.
results_summary: The study found that Pyo and NADH acted as homogeneous catalysts, producing reactive oxygen species that oxidized phenanthrene, leading to ring cleavage and formation of lower molecular weight metabolites. This process improved the BOD5/COD ratio of wastewater and promoted bacterial growth, indicating enhanced bioavailability.
population_specificity: Phenanthrene-containing wastewater treated with P. aeruginosa NY3 extracellular secretions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the Nampt/NAD axis plays a role in the pathogenesis of obesity-induced atrial fibrillation (AF) and if nicotinamide riboside (an NAD precursor) could mitigate AF perpetuation.
results_summary: The study found that partial deletion of Nampt exacerbated high-fat diet-induced AF, linked to increased diastolic calcium leaks, and treatment with nicotinamide riboside partially restored AF perpetuation.
population_specificity: Male C57BL/6J mice (wild-type and heterozygous Nampt knockout).

study_goal: To assess the effect of Jianpi Huazhuo Tiaozhi granules (JHTG) on oxidative stress damage in macrophages and explore its relationship with the NOX/ROS-NF-κB signaling pathway.
results_summary: JHTG treatment reduced oxidative stress damage and apoptosis in macrophages, increased superoxide dismutase levels, and decreased ROS levels. It also downregulated NOX4, p22phox, IKK-α, IKK-β, and NF-κB expression, with effects correlating to JHTG concentration.
population_specificity: In vitro cultured macrophages

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide (NAD) and its related enzymes (NOXs) as therapeutic targets for neurodegenerative diseases by inhibiting oxidative stress and neuroinflammation.
results_summary: The study found that NOX enzymes play a critical role in oxidative stress and neuroinflammation, and their inhibition shows neuroprotective effects in neurodegenerative disease models. However, current NOX inhibitors face challenges like nonspecificity, toxicity, and poor pharmacokinetics, limiting clinical use.
population_specificity: Neurodegenerative disease models (not specified if human or animal).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential benefits and risks of nicotinamide-related compounds, including NAD+, in treating diabetes, particularly focusing on their effects on NAD+ levels and oxidative stress.
results_summary: The study found that while replenishing NAD+ levels could be beneficial for diabetic patients, nicotinamide-related compounds may increase oxidative stress due to elevated nicotinamide catabolites. Combining these compounds with insulin sensitizers, polyphenols, benfotiamine, acetyl-L-carnitine, and aldose reductase inhibitors was suggested to minimize risks and maximize benefits.
population_specificity: Patients with diabetes (type 1 and type 2).
interactions: Insulin sensitizers, polyphenols, benfotiamine, acetyl-L-carnitine, and aldose reductase inhibitors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of NADPH oxidase in ROS production and its potential as a therapeutic target for ROS-driven cancers, including the regulation by miRNAs.
results_summary: The study found that NADPH oxidase is a key player in ROS production and is associated with various malignancies. Targeting NADPH oxidase through miRNAs shows promise for treating ROS-driven cancers, though current therapeutic strategies face challenges due to complex regulatory mechanisms.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on molecular and cellular mechanisms in ROS-driven cancers).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether NMNAT3, by regulating NAD+ levels, improves mitochondrial function and anti-oxidative stress in rabbit bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells (BMSCs) under oxidative stress.
results_summary: NMNAT3 overexpression increased NAD+ and ATP levels, improved mitochondrial function, reduced oxidative stress markers (ROS, MDA), enhanced antioxidant enzyme activity (Mn-SOD, CAT), and decreased senescence and apoptosis in BMSCs under oxidative stress.
population_specificity: Rabbit bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells (BMSCs) in vitro.
effective_dosage: Not specified (H2O2 used to induce oxidative stress).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the antifibrotic mechanism of benazepril by studying its effect on Nrf2, NOX4, and ROS in rats with hepatic fibrosis.
results_summary: Benazepril treatment reduced NOX4 mRNA expression and ROS concentration while increasing Nrf2 mRNA expression, suggesting it may mitigate hepatic fibrosis by modulating oxidative stress pathways. Positive correlations were found between Nrf2, NOX4, and ROS levels.
population_specificity: Male Sprague-Dawley rats with CCL4-induced hepatic fibrosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether exogenous NAD protects the myocardium from ischemia-reperfusion-induced oxidative injury by regulating the Sirt5-SDH pathway and succinate metabolism.
results_summary: NAD administration increased myocardial NAD levels, reduced oxidative injury markers (LDH, MDA), improved GSH/GSSG ratio, attenuated cardiac dysfunction, and decreased succinate accumulation during ischemia-reperfusion by promoting Sirt5-mediated SDH-a desuccinylation.
population_specificity: Isolated rat hearts subjected to ischemia-reperfusion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to confirm the role of the PKC-α/NOX signaling pathway in Psoralea corylifolia L. (PC) compounds' effects on nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and screen effective compounds for NASH treatment.
results_summary: Psoralen, Isopsoralen, and Isobavachalcone reduced triglyceride levels, while all five PC compounds improved cholesterol accumulation, hepatocyte damage, oxidative stress, and downregulated the PKC-α/NOX pathway. Psoralen showed the best efficacy but lost effectiveness when pre-stimulated with a PKC-α activator.
population_specificity: Primary hepatocyte model of NAFLD induced by palmitic acid.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the role of salusin-β in vascular calcification (VC) and its downstream signaling mechanisms involving NAD(P)H oxidase and reactive oxygen species (ROS).
results_summary: Salusin-β overexpression increased VC by promoting osteochondrogenic transition, decreasing Klotho protein levels, and enhancing NAD(P)H oxidase activity and ROS production, while salusin-β deficiency had the opposite effects. The study suggests salusin-β regulates VC through NAD(P)H/ROS-mediated Klotho downregulation.
population_specificity: VC rats induced by vitamin D3 and nicotine, and vascular smooth muscle cells (VSMCs) incubated with calcifying media.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the toxic effects of carbon black nanoparticles (Printex 90) on the neural cell line PC-12, focusing on mechanisms involving NOX and ER stress.
results_summary: Printex 90 significantly reduced cell viability, increased reactive oxygen species, decreased ATP, upregulated NOX2/NOX4 and ER stress markers, and reduced antioxidative enzymes, indicating neural damage via NOX and ER stress pathways.
population_specificity: Neural cell line PC-12 (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of NADPH oxidase and mitochondria in ROS production and discuss antioxidants, including potential targeted therapies, for managing oxidative stress-related conditions.
results_summary: The study highlights the role of ROS in endothelial dysfunction and oxidative stress-related diseases, focusing on antioxidants that inhibit NADPH oxidase and mitochondrial ROS sources, suggesting targeted therapy as a potential approach.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of in-vitro, in-vivo, and clinical data).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of NOX inhibition, including apocynin, in mitigating hyperglycemia's impact on ischemic stroke and discuss potential therapeutic strategies.
results_summary: The study found that NOX activation and glucose metabolism derangements increase apoptosis in ischemic stroke, and NOX inhibition may reduce reperfusion injury. Apocynin and more specific NOX inhibitors were highlighted as potential treatments.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on ischemic stroke pathology).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of NMDA receptor-mediated NOX-induced oxidative stress in seizure initiation and whether NOX inhibition could prevent seizures.
results_summary: The study found that seizure onset is linked to rapid H2O2 release due to NMDA receptor-mediated NOX activation. NOX blockade prevented seizures in both hippocampal slices and in vivo rat models, suggesting NOX inhibition as a potential treatment for focal epilepsies.
population_specificity: Mouse hippocampal slices and acutely induced seizures in rats.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether exogenous NAD+ induces immune responses and disease resistance in citrus plants, specifically against citrus canker caused by Xanthomonas citri subsp. citri (Xcc).
results_summary: NAD+ treatment induced significant transcriptome changes and strong resistance to citrus canker in citrus plants. The resistance persisted in new flushes and primed tissues for faster, stronger immune responses upon subsequent Xcc infection.
population_specificity: Citrus plants (woody plant species)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of NADPH on platelet function and its mechanisms of action, particularly its potential as a novel compound for managing high-risk cardiovascular disease.
results_summary: NADPH inhibited platelet aggregation induced by ADP, thrombin, or AA in a concentration-dependent manner, reduced oxidative stress, and inhibited p38 phosphorylation. In vivo, NADPH delayed vessel occlusion in a thrombosis model and transiently prolonged bleeding time without affecting coagulation response.
population_specificity: Mice and rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the NAD(H) pool size and NAD+/NADH ratio could serve as biomarkers for colorectal cancer (CRC) progression and explore the role of NAMPT-mediated NAD+ salvage pathway activation in this process.
results_summary: The study found that NAD(H) pool size and NAD+/NADH ratio increased during CRC progression due to NAMPT upregulation, which protected cancer cells from oxidative stress. NADH fluorescence intensity, measured by TPEF microscopy, was consistently elevated in CRC models, suggesting its potential as a monitoring tool for CRC progression.
population_specificity: CRC cell lines, AOM/DSS-induced CRC tissues in mice, and tumor tissues from CRC patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of NADPH oxidase-generated ROS in IP6-induced metabolic disruption in human leukemia PLB-985 cells.
results_summary: IP6 treatment suppressed cell growth more dramatically in PLB-985 cells than in X-CGD cells, increased necrosis in PLB-985 cells, and influenced CD11b and LC3 expression differently between the cell lines, suggesting NADPH oxidase mediates IP6-induced metabolic effects.
population_specificity: Human leukemia PLB-985 cells and X-CGD cells (gp91-phox gene knockout).
effective_dosage: 5, 10, or 20 mM IP6 for 24 to 72 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether nicotinamide riboside, an NAD+ precursor, could improve NAD+ cellular content and cardiac function in a model of LMNA cardiomyopathy.
results_summary: The study found that oral administration of nicotinamide riboside improved NAD+ cellular content, increased PARylation of cardiac proteins, and enhanced left ventricular structure and function in LMNA cardiomyopathy models.
population_specificity: Mouse and human models carrying LMNA mutations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and benefits of NAD+ precursors in attenuating NAD+ decline in degenerative disease states and physiological aging.
results_summary: The study found that enhancing NAD+ levels can reduce oxidative cell damage and promote protective cell responses, suggesting NAD+ precursors may be beneficial in age-associated degenerative diseases.
